name: Can You Master this Quiz? | Mixed  5 Questions | 5 Questions

questions.text: The Stirling Hypothesis theorized that the origin of the Olmec and Mayan people resulted from the sexual union between Eve and which feral force of nature?
questions.explanation:
Jaguar.

	Matthew Stirling is an anthropologist specializing in Meso-American civilizations.  The jaguar is a familiar figure in the mythos of these Central American civilization of the ancient past.

questions.text: The ancient Chinese philosopher that we call 'Confucius' was originally from which ancient state of China?
questions.explanation:
Lu.

	The ancient state of Lu was located in the area of modern Shandong, a province of modern China.  Confucius was born Kong Qiu, but took on the name Kong Fu Zi to signify that he was a master teacher.  Confucius is the Latinized form of his name.

questions.text: In which of the following classes of animal would you classify an "echeneis" ?
questions.explanation:
Fish.

	The echeneis ("Echeneis naucrates") is another term for the slender suckerfish that attaches itself to larger fish such as sharks (see also, remoras).  They feed on scraps of food from the meals of their hosts.

questions.text: Which famed artist garnered the nickname 'the lady of the lilies' for obvious reasons (if you've seen her artwork!)?
questions.explanation:
O'Keeffe.

	Georgia O'Keeffe became famous for her paintings of flowers, thus the nickname.  There are some interesting hypotheses behind the symbolic nature of her flowers, but we won't discuss that here!

questions.text: Back in the time of Marco Polo, by what name did Westerners know China?
questions.explanation:
Cathay.

	The word "Cathay" is derived from "Khitai" after the Khitan people who ruled Northern China during the period of the Song Dynasty (approx. 1000-1200).
